Directorate is the competent authority for registration of veterinary medicinal products.
The producer can submit an application for license for release of a trade of veterinary medicinal
products, and for a foreign producer, an authorized agent with permanent residence in the Republic
of Macedonia. The applications are reviewed by a committee, as they are submitted. The license for
trade release is issued based on a proposal/recommendation of the Committee for Veterinary
Medicinal Products. The Committee members are appointed by the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry
and Water Economy, out of the pool of prominent medicinal, dental, pharmaceutical, veterinary and
other technical and scientific individuals. The Committees function on the basis of their rules of
procedure and are technically independent within their scope of work. The Faculty of Veterinary
Medicine is the authorized institution for laboratory analyses (pharmaceutical and chemical) of the
veterinary medicinal products through their examination methods, as well as the report of performed
The license for trade release of a veterinary medicinal products is issued for no longer than a period
of 5 years. The trade release license could be reconsidered at any time and it is subject of a group
assessment, in accordance with the relevant procedures specified by the law.

text.b: 15. Principles governing the organisation of official controls.

page.text: The supervision over the implementation of legal regulations in the field of animal nutrition, according
to the Law on Veterinary Health (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 28/98) and the Livestock Law (“Official
Gazette of RM” No. 61/97) is performed by the competent authorities within the Ministry of
Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy: the Veterinary Directorate and State Agriculture
The state veterinary inspectors perform mandatory sanitary control of establishments and equipment
for production, processing and trade, the shops and other points of sale for feedingstuffs, the
feedingstuffs itself and the water for animal nutrition.
During the inspection supervision, the veterinary inspector has the right and duty to perform the
following: veterinary sanitary inspection and control of safety of premixes, feedingstuffs, water for
animal nutrition and water used in the production process, take and send material for laboratory
analises; to perform continuous examinations of feedingstuffs, water for animal animal nutrition and
water used in the production process, as well as possible presence of harmful material; to forbid
production, trade and use of feedingstuffs and water for animal nutrition , if they contain pathogenic
bacteria or material harmful for animal health; to forbid loading, reloading and offloading of
feedingstuffs if it does not fulfill the specified conditions; to forbid use of transportation vehicles for
transport of feedingstuffs if they do not fulfill the specified conditions; to confiscate and destroy
feedingstuffs which is non safe ; to order elimination of irregularities in production and trade of
feedingstuffs; take samples of products, raw materials and wastes of feediningstuffs or
feedadditives, water for animal nutrition and water using in production process with an aim to
examine whether they fulfill the conditions for safety, and determine the necessary veterinary-
sanitary measures for protection of the feedingstuffs and water for animal nutrition.
The State Agriculture Inspectorate performs inspection supervision from quality of feedingstuffs
through the state agriculture inspectors. The state agriculture inspector has the right to perform
supervision over production of and trade in feedingstuffs, to take samples of raw material and
feedingstuffs. The inspector can temporarily forbid implementation of an activity if he determines
irregularity in operations, or if a legal entity does no longer fulfill any of the specified legal conditions,
till a final decision is made on taking the permit away/cancellation.

text.b: 16. Conditions and arrangements for approving and registering certain establishments and
intermediaries operating in the animal feed sector.

page.text: Approving and registration of establishment for production and trade in feedingstuffs is regulated by
the Law on Veterinary Health (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 28/98) and the Livestock Law (“Official
According to the Livestock Law (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 61/97), production of compond
feedingstuffs intended for trade can be performed only by a legal entity that fulfills specified
conditions. The conditions that the legal entity has to fulfill are specified by the Minister of Agriculture,
According to the Law on Veterinary Health (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 28/98), regular veterinary-
sanitary control is performed on establishment for production, processing and trade in feedingstuffs,
and in case of suspecting presence of contagious disease, the control includes the feedingstuffs too,
in the yard of the owners of animals.
The Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy specifies the method of sample taking,
method of implementation of veterinary-sanitary control of feedingstuffs and the technical and
technological conditions inside the facilities in which feedingstuffs is produced.
The legal entities that perform production, processing, warehousing, trade and sale of feedingstuffs
are required to report the facilities and equipment, as well as any change related to them within
seven days, to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy, for their registration into the
register of establishments for production, processing, warehousing, trade and sale of feedingstuffs.
The Veterinary Directorate maintains a register of establishments for production, processing and

text.b: 17. Methods of sampling and analysis for the official control of feedingstuffs.

page.text: Samples taking of feedingstuffs and raw material for feedingstuffs is performed in accordance with
the Rulebook on Methods for Taking Samples and Methods for Physical, Chemical and
Microbiological Analysis of Feedingstuffs (“Official Gazette of SFRY” No. 15/87).
Samples taking of feedingstuffs can be performed by state veterinary inspectors, in accordance with
the Law on Veterinary Health (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 28/98), and the state agriculture
veterinary inspectors, as regulated by the Livestock Law.
According to the Livestock Law (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 61/97), an analysis or super-analysis
could be made for proper determination of the declared quality of feedingstuffs released for trade,
The analysis and super-analysis are performed by laboratories authorized by the Minister of
The inspector is required to inform the producer or trade organization from which the sample of
feedingstuffs has been taken, on the analysis results. If the feedingstuffs producer or the trade
organization that sells the feedingstuffs is not satisfied with the analysis results, it can request a
super-analysis within 8 days of the day of being informed on the analysis result, and it should be
done on the same sample (third bag), that is retained by the inspector. If the super-analysis result is
not identical with the analysis result, i.e. it significantly differs from the analysis result, than the super-
analysis result is taken for valid. The expenses for analysis and super-analysis are charged to the
producer or trade organization for feedingstuffs, if the obtained results differ from the ones stated on
the declaration. In cases when the results of analysis and super-analysis are identical to the
declaration, the expenses are charged to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy.
According to the Law on Veterinary Health (“Official Gazette of RM” No. 28/98), the establishments
registered for production and processing of feedingstuffs, before releasing it for trade, are required to
perform laboratory analyses in a laboratory authorized by the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and
If the laboratory confirms that the feedingstuffs fulfills the specified conditions, it issues an attest. The
analysis results of the samples of feedingstuffs can be disputed within eight days of the day the result
has been issued, with a request for repeated analysis (super-analysis). If the super-analysis does not
correspond to the result of the analysis, then the result of the super-analysis is taken as valid. The
super-analysis result is final. The expenses for feedingstuffs analysis and super-analysis are charged
to the owner, and in cases when the super-analysis results are in favor of the owner, the expenses
are charged to the institution whose employee performed the analysis.

i.b: G. Veterinary and Phytosanitary International Agreements

text.b: 1. List the bilateral veterinary and phytosanitary international agreements with EU Member
States, candidate countries and other third countries.
